keyboard accelerators work even if menus actions are disabled.
this happens in every perspective, on every menu.

(In reply to comment #2)
> Can you provide an example?

Having "Debug" perspective opened, on "Variables" view, there are 4 menus on right click mouse which are DISABLED if no application in "Debug" view. Those menus are: "Select All Ctrl+A", "Copy Variables Ctrl+C", "Find Variable Ctrl+F", "Change Value".
Having focus on "Variables" view, press "Ctrl+F" (Find Variable) and will work.

This is a simple example, I have founded the problem in all UI menus which causes Eclipse crashes.

Ciprian Pataca

I have problems understanding how Eclipse would crash in the use case you give (and it doesn't for me).  This problem happens for you in Eclipse 3.1.1, but it worked differently in Eclipse 3.1?  Did it work differently in Eclipse 3.0?

Actions (which appear in popup menus) are a different thing than commands and handlers (which are executed when a keyboard accelerator is pressed).  So, while the action may be disable, this does not mean that the handler is disabled.  You must disable the handler when appropriate.

1. The test case I gave was not one to make Ecplise to crash, it was just to explain what I mean into bug report.

2. If a keyboard accelerator is associated to an action and if the action is disabled, I think that also the accelerator must be disabled too.
If the action is not permitted into a context, using associated accelerator, the action will be performed and this may cause crashes. 

3. On 3.1 have same comportment on test case I provided, on 3.0 for same test case, there are not accelerators on actions, so not relevant.

4. I'll give another example which shows that it is not a normal comportment:
Having JBOSS plug-in installed, on mouse right click on a project, there is a menu item: "Deployment" with 3 sub menus, one of them: "Redeploy Ctrl+Shift+F3".
From "Resource" perspective, on a "Java Project" all 3 sub menus are disabled, but the accelerator Ctrl+Shift+F3 works successful - even if the project is closed!!! - which is not normal.
And will have also eclipse crashed - "An internal error occurred during: "Redeployment of ". ".

I think this is not JBOSS plug-in business, as long the menu action is disabled.

Well, the action and the handler are two different things.  Let's take a look at "Redploy".  In this case, it looks like JBOSS has contributed an action set, and this action set is getting called when you press Ctrl+Shift+F3.  Instead of right-clicking, try looking in the top-level menus.  Is there a "Redploy" menu item there?  Is it enabled or disabled?

Yes, you are perfectlly right, it exists and is enabled(JBOSS problem).
